Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Thin crust 10" below the surface from warmup the other day. This crust had small grained facets underneath the crust and broken stellars above the crust. The new snow was bonding well to the crust. In this location there was no melt-freeze crust associated with the dirt layer.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit is adjacent to avalanche: crown;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Profile taken on far east (looker's right) side of the avalanche crown. Very thin. Avalanche broke at 52 cm. Average crown height appeared to be 2-3 feet with one short section section in the cornice about 10 feet deep
Sten och växtlighet ovan vald plats. Platt innan början på konvex. Läplats. Botten ojämn pga sten och växtlighet. På jakt efter feb 22 FC och förändringar i snötäcket pga solpåverkan.

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Pit dug approx. 200 feet below ridgeline where there hadn't been wind loading after the last snow event, but there was mild loading occurring on whole slope during digging/testing. Windy day in all of W. Willow Basin.
For the ECT, we did not cut below the topmost ice crust at 253. I mainly wanted to assess the bonding between the new snow and that crust.
Solig sydsida. Sökte främst tempen.

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
We skied slope;
We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: ECTN results in the top 2' of the snowpack. These will settle out over time. Overall ECTX with failure on faceted graupel layer above a pencil hard rounded grains with propagation x2 after ECTX with a hard shovel pry. I would be surprised if this layer was the culprit in further avalanches.
Klart, kallt och rimfrost på snöytan. 2-3m/s från SO.
Liten brant sluttning på E asp. Grävde ner 80 cm. Avblåst och hårt.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit dug in a Ski Area;
We skied slope;
Ski tracks on slope; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Amazing to find a southwest facing slope with this much dry snow and so few crusts at the end of March. HS was more than 465cm. I couldn't find the bottom with a 300cm probe. Propagation at 340cm after ECTX on the ice crust. I couldn't find signs of a major grain hand hardness change above the crust. Some ECTN's in the top 3' of the snow- not repeatable. Surface crust with NSF above is worth noting as we move forward.

Pit_Observation.activities: Ski tracks on slope; We skied slope;

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Í gær sást að fallið hafði snjóflóð úr Hestskarðshnjúk líklegast 24/3 með viðhorf í suðvestur. Brotstálið fer eftir fjalsegginni undir kletta á Pallahnjúk og inn allan Skútudal. Flóðið hafði fallið fram af Skútubrúnum niður og yfir Skútuána upp í hlíðina á Hólshyrnu, 50-60 m. Flóðið hafði líka fallið yfir borholu hitaveitunnar, holu 10, sem er syðst og niður í árgilið vestan við. Líklegast er þetta eitt samhangandi flóð. Tók aðra gryfju í Skarðdalsviki með viðhorf í norður; við sögun brotnaði súlan og rann.
DR TT Mid path 2 bears. Objectives were to get visual on snowpack to ground. No time for tests and wanted to limit exposure to another group of skiers.

Athugun á stöðugleika viðvarandi veiks lags, engin nýleg snjóflóðavirkni á svæðinu. Yfirborðshrím greinanlegt á yfirborði en í litlu magni. Veika lagið á 51-63 cm er mun þynnra í hinum enda gryfjunnar Óformlegt stöðugleikapróf í S-vísandi viðhorfi ofan Bungulyftu með heldur þéttari snjóþekju en svipaða lagskiptingu, CT17@40.

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Quick Pit to look for March 12 SH.

Pit dug near the crown of a fatal avalanche accident in an area locally known as Green Trees in Maroon Bowl of Highlands Peak. The total snowpack consisted of 15.5" of SWE with the slab making up 12.9" of the total SWE (SWE measurements: Slab 329.0 mm of water in 142.6 cm of snow / basal facet layer 115 mm of water in 40.6 cm of snow)

Pit_Observation.activities: Cracking; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: pit dug on previously wind scoured slope. other areas had HS around 160cm
Only dug to 120 cm.

Pit_Observation.activities: Ski tracks on slope; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes:
Stable conditions observed at this location, at the bottom part of a slope with a western aspect. Conditions may be different at the top of this slope, but the snow cover there seems less than at the pit location.
The new snow from yesterday, which was dry and fell as dendrites, varies from a few cm at the pit location to probably around 15 cm in other, more wind-loaded places higher up on the same slope - but in general it is not a lot. It turned moist throughout the course of the day due to sunshine and warm temperatures on all aspects except on true north locations higher up on the slope towards Kamilata Peak, where it remained mostly powdery. This wettening of the surface layer made it bond better to the crusty layer below it, but at the places where it remained powdery, it had no bond with the crusty, icy layer below it and slid very easily. This is not worrying at the moment because the new snow is not a lot.
A large part of the snowpack is very hard and icy, but at around 50 cm from the surface, the ice disappears and the snow turns heavy and moist, maybe due to surface warmness of the ground.
I did not observe any real amount of graupel or sugary snow, in contrast to many other locations at the moment. Also no distinct entirely yellow layers, except a small amount within the icy layers.
Sunny day, air completely still - no wind at all, warm temperatures, temperature of -1C at around 2400 meters (different from pit location) below Kamilata Peak on a north aspect, at around 15:30. Evident wettening of the surface snow causing snowballs to naturally slide on the surface on all eastern slopes, and those with a true west orientation towards the end of the day, after getting some direct sunlight.
At the moment the temps were not warm enough on NW slopes to cause any problems.
Avalanche activity - none recently, likely a very old slab, relatively small observed at the bottom part of the eastern slope under Malka Malyovitsa.
Could be complications this week with perhaps a large and likely wet snowfall coming Tuesday evening, then very warm temps towards the end of the week.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit is adjacent to avalanche: crown;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: The Avalanche likely broke around 3/14 and failed on a layer of faceted snow at 122 cm. Avalanche: 35-40 degrees steepness. 250' vert, 500' width, 2-4' depth. N-R3-D2-HS

Pit_Observation.activities: Recent avalanche activity on similar slopes; We skied slope;

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Kesängin Kaakon kulman länsipuolella puurajan yläpuolella. Uudessa lumessa rajapinta (20cm down) antoi reaktioita testeissä, mutta ei reaktioitai suksi/käsi testeissä. Ei muita havaintoja epästabiilista lumesta Jyrkempiä paikkoja ei tosin oltu laskettu. Uusi lumi sitoutunut melko hyvin MfCr kerrokseen, eikä propagoitunut. Puurajan yläpuolella tuuli vaikuttanut monin paikoin. Auringon vaikutus havaittavaissa eteläpuolen jyrkemmillä rinteillä, mutta ei vielä sulattanut pintaa.
Planar slope open terrain.

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: ALP, så perfekt lä man kan få på höjd på NV vind, bakom en liten stenås. 3 st ECT, alla ECTN på lite olika ställen i nysnön.
Dug a pit for practice. Aspect NNW, 20° slope. Depth 170cm. ECTP11, failed around 148. Appeared to be storm slab failing on small facets. ECTN27 around 130, fairly hard slab about 10cm thick.

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Very cold, clear nights the past three days. Lot's of rime on trees above this elevation.

Winds were moderate to strong NNE on ridgetops with active wind-loading on ridgetops. We were looking to see how the February PWL layer was reacting below treeline on north facings slopes. No propagation with ECT's at this site.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Deep Snowpack. Could not probe to ground. Near crust faceting observed in the upper 15cm of the snowpack.

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: venue of Bansko Freeride World Tour Qualifier 2023 - top part; GOOD stability of slope, only small slides of the top powder, even after removing cornices; The crust bellow may collapse after jumps; No further snowfalls expected till the competition. Temperatures low, gradually increasing; No avalanche activity the next two days during the competition!
